import React from 'react'; import PropTypes from 'prop-types'; import { Doughnut } from 'react-chartjs-2'; const areaColorMap = { maroon: '#ce237a', blue: '#1aa3ef', purple: '#752189', green: '#3a8745', orange: '#e28100', }; const data = (percentage, color) => ({ datasets: [{ data: [100, 100-percentage], backgroundColor: [ areaColorMap[color], 'rgb(234, 234, 234)', ], }], }) const progressBarStyling = { transition: 'width .2s ease in', } // TODO: Implement doughnut charts const CourseProgress = ({ state: { startDate, testDate, progress, improvement, lessons, instruction, practiceTests }, active }) => (

Course Progress

Start Date {startDate}
Test Date Oct SAT ({testDate})
Once the course begins, check here to be sure the student is on track.
{active && {progress}%}
data(improvement, 'maroon')} width={156} height={156} options={{ cutoutPercentage: 75, }} />
Improvement {improvement}% vs target score None Yet
data(lessons, 'purple')} width={156} height={156} options={{ cutoutPercentage: 75, }} />
Lessons {lessons}% vs scheduled lessons None Scheduled
data(instruction, 'orange')} width={156} height={156} options={{ cutoutPercentage: 75, }} />
Instruction {instruction}% vs scheduled instruction None Scheduled
data(practiceTests, 'blue')} width={156} height={156} options={{ cutoutPercentage: 75, }} />
Practice Tests {practiceTests}% vs scheduled tests None Scheduled
Complete
Behind Schedule
); CourseProgress.propTypes = { state: PropTypes.object.isRequired, active: PropTypes.bool.isRequired, }; export default CourseProgress;
